conclusion: Analyze the behavior of the light ray considering reflection and refraction.
Incident ray makes an angle θ = 30° with the vertical axis OO'.
Incident angle with respect to the normal is 60°.
Using Snell's Law: n sin i = sin r.
n sin 60° = sin r or n · √3/2 = sin r.
Ray reflects internally off the curved surface of the semicircle.
Reflected ray makes the same angle 60° with the normal on reflection.
Reflected ray emerges and travels vertically downward to the screen CD.
Refracted ray exits and travels at an angle β with the vertical.
Distance between two bright spots is (√3 + 1)R.
Vertical distance by reflected ray is l2 = R.
Horizontal distance by refracted ray is l1 = R tan β.
Total distance l1 + l2 = R tan β + R = (√3 + 1)R.
Simplifying gives tan β = √3, implying β = 60°.
Substitute β = 60° into Snell's Law: n · √3/2 = √3/2.
The refractive index of the glass is √2.
